comments:
Editing e.g. tapestry ancillary files, such as MyApp.application, generates an NPE. I have configured eclipse (3.2.1) to associate *.application file types with the WTP XML Editor. This also happens with *.page files. (and *.jwc files)

I renamed my file (CreateRandomOrder.application) to "CreateRandomOrder.xml" and the xml editor opened it with no NPE. Therefore I don't believe the file is corrupt.

I'm running with MacOS 10.4.8 -- macintel machine. Java version is:

Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-113)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-68, mixed mode, sharing)

Is this the only exception and message in the log?  Do you have any other editors installed for dealing with those kinds of files?

From your description, I'm guessing you used the File Associations preference page to associate your *.application file type to the XML editor.  Did you associate your *.application file type to the XML content type using the Content Types preference page (General -> Content Types)?

I was running into this problem, but I think I have a workaround. I had initially configured the associations using General -> Editors -> File Associations, but was getting the NPE as described above.

So, I removed the associations, and instead set them up using General -> Content Types, and associated them with Text -> XML.

After restarting Eclipse, it worked like a charm.
